name: Bridle Road to Bignor Walk, Slindon

ai.summary: A challenging 21.7 km point-to-point hike from Bridle Road to Bignor Walk, near Slindon in the UK. The route combines rural lanes, bridleways, woodlands and open chalk downland, with notable elevation changes and a demanding pace suitable for experienced walkers.
ai.terrain_summary: The trail uses a mix of solid country lanes, gravel bridleways, woodland paths and open downland. Expect uneven ground, possible mud after rain, short steep sections, and exposure on higher ridges with wide views across the countryside.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a long day and check the weather forecast. Wear sturdy boots with good grip, and bring layered clothing plus a waterproof outer layer. Carry enough water and high-energy snacks for the 21.7 km distance, and have a map and compass or a reliable GPS. Let someone know your planned route and return time. Take care on narrow lanes and around farm access, and keep dogs under close control. Navigation can be challenging in woodland sections; stay on marked paths and be prepared for sudden weather changes.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Layered clothing plus a waterproof outer shell
Map and compass or a GPS device (with route downloaded)
Sunscreen, sunglasses and a hat for sun protection
Lightweight emergency blanket or space blanket
Phone with offline map and power bank
ai.best_seasons: Spring and autumn offer the best balance of daylight and drier conditions; the route is doable year-round, but winter mud and summer heat can make the hike more demanding.
